taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Festuca saximontana var. purpusiana (St.-Yves) Fred. & Pavlick

bio:treatment.description: Culms (5)8-20(25) cm, usually 2-3 times the height of the vegetative shoot leaves, usually glabrous below the inflorescence. Outer vegetative shoot sheaths mostly stramineous; blades smooth or scabrous on the abaxial surfaces, ribs on the adaxial surfaces with hairs shorter than 0.06 mm; abaxial sclerenchyma in 5-7 narrow abaxial strands. Lemmas usually scabrous towards the apices and often along the margins.
bio:treatment.discussion: Festuca saximontana var. purpusiana grows in subalpine or lower alpine habitats. The distribution of this taxon is poorly known; it probably extends from Alaska south to northern California. It is also reported from the Chukchi Peninsula in eastern Russia (Tzvelev 1976).
